file_content.text: Calm. Calm now. Who would have thought?
They made it out! Bola and Uthril and Nug, they escaped in the confusion!
Sorry. Too loud? The torture machines, they're irreparable without someone who knows them. They're complete slag.
And my cohorts, my co-workers, my family, they're free of the machines. Thank you.
The Empire will no doubt sweep the area.
Be careful out there.
Sure. But without machines or repair staff, they'll be forced to scrap their little project.
In the meantime, we'll get the victims somewhere off-planet to heal and disappear. They've been through a lot.
Thank you for all you've done. For once, desperation on this moon turned into something good.
Credits say "thank you" too.
Yeah, I promised, didn't I? Everything... well, I don't have much, but here it is.
You saved my adopted family. It means something to them, and more, to me.
If you hadn't saved them, I'd probably be on a bridge somewhere on the wrong side of the railing. So... see you around.
I didn't realize your family was in there.
Your family?
No, not blood relatives, I lost those long ago. These workers are my adopted family.
To most people on Nar Shaddaa, family's just another angle, but not to us.
It is as close as we come to having honor on this moon. Thank you for making that possible.
The machines. Smash the torture machines!
You! Do you have a blaster? I need a blaster.
Damn Imperials think I'll do nothing. You can't figure everything out with torture!
Well? How about it? Can I have a blaster?
I'm sure that decision can wait until you relax a little.
Calm down.
Relax? Every minute here is fine for you and me, but it's agony for....
Medication not working today?
I see you're completely nuts.
Yeah, call me crazy. That's fair. When they take your friends, your job, they put you in the machine....
Explain yourself, first.
Huh? Oh, yeah, I might be coming at this wrong. A day in the device will do that to your mind.
Hi. I'm Uli. I maintained machines in the Empire's Project Threshold, an experimental, uh, training program in the art of interrogation.
Why should I help an Imperial torturer?
You're an interrogator?
We just maintained the machines! And after a while, we couldn't even stand that.
You... you see things in a place like that. So we broke in one night to, uh... sabotage the machines. And they caught us.
You gotta help me here. The other guys... they're on the machines now, all they know is pain. I gotta break the machines.
I suppose that's one way of paying the bills.
Did what you had to, huh?
Don't judge me. We needed the jobs, but after a few months of... seeing things, we couldn't stand it.
We tried to sabotage the torture machines, but they got us. I barely escaped, and the others....
You're still babbling.
I'm saying, my men and I maintained experimental Imperial torture machinery. Then we had an attack of conscience.
But when we tried to sabotage the machines, we got caught. Only a few of us escaped.
The others are in the machines. I need--someone needs to save them. They're hurt, dying in there. I gotta break these machines.
The Empire won't do this on my watch.
I'll help you.
Brave. You haven't seen what happens to those who fail. But nevermind that. Destroy the machines and their guards.
It is good you came to me. I will ease their pain.
I will free them.
The devices are the target. They'll be guarded, but guards will be replaced. These machines can't.
I'll get your men out of these devices. Point me at them.
Sounds clear-cut. I'm in.
They'll be guarded, but I don't think they'll be prepared for someone like you.
If I touch it, consider it broken. This'll be easy.
I'm good at that.
Be careful in there. Since our attempt, they've doubled the number of soldiers around the machines.
And if there's an officer or archon in there, end him. I won't list his crimes, just know they are unspeakable.
Thank you for doing this. In return... in return, everything I have is yours.
Is there a reward for helping?
If you free them, you can have whatever I've got.
Just destroy the machines, and watch out for the archon overseeing the project. He is merciless.
If I believed even half this stuff, I'd be a fool.
You're lying. [Refuse quest.]
I know how I sound. Why do you think no one listens?
A blaster. I need a blaster.
